column4: I have a USB thumb drive and it shows up in lsusb, but it never mounts.  How to mount this drive?
did you remove your USB safely?
if you're going to use a USB flash disk, you are supposed to SAFELY remove the USB...
I understand, but that does not help me mount it :)
if the USB is removed just like whiz, Bookman, it goes on read-only mode...
sudo mkdir /media/disk - then do the next one
sudo mount/dev/sdb (assuming that the USB is SDB) /media/disk
I'm here but your last statement makes no sense
you will type those on a terminal, Bookman...
This makes no sense:  sudo mount/dev/sdb
I assume you mean sudo mount /dev/sdb /media/disk
and I get mount: you must specify the filesystem type
